options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: The modern viewer has no engagement with art from other ages, finding it irrelevant to their lives.

options.label: D
options.text: The modern viewer has an equally rich engagement with both art from other ages and contemporary art.

multiple-choice.question: What role do curators play in organizing exhibits, according to the transcript?

options.label: D

options.label: D

title: How to choose your news - Damon Brown

multiple-choice.question: How did people primarily consume news in the past?

options.label: A
options.text: Through online news outlets and social media platforms

options.label: B
options.text: Through a variety of specialized news sources and podcasts

options.label: C
options.text: Through a limited number of general interest magazines, newspapers of record, and a few TV networks

options.label: D
options.text: Through community newsletters and local radio stations

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of scandals revealing that democratic governments were misleading the public?

options.label: A
options.text: An increase in public trust in media gatekeepers

options.label: B
options.text: A decrease in the number of alternative news sources

options.label: C
options.text: A breakdown of trust in official narratives presented by mainstream sources

options.label: D
options.text: A significant increase in government transparency efforts

multiple-choice.question: What is one effective way to get close to the truth when consuming news?

options.label: C
options.text: By accessing the original news unfiltered by middlemen

options.label: D
options.text: By following only government-approved sources

multiple-choice.question: How can you stay informed during major events like the Arab Spring or the Ukrainian protests?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Ignore the event and wait for a polished version to appear in articles or broadcasts

options.label: C
options.text: Follow reporters on social media and bloggers posting updates and recordings from the midst of the chaos

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: What strategy is recommended for following events like terrorist attacks and natural disasters?

options.label: A
options.text: Check for the latest information every few minutes to stay up-to-date

options.label: B
options.text: Try to follow it in real time through social media and news outlets

options.label: C
options.text: Check for the latest information at several points in the day, allowing time for complete details to emerge and false reports to be refuted

options.label: D
options.text: Ignore the event and wait for a polished version to appear in articles or broadcasts

multiple-choice.question: What may indicate media bias or a need for caution when reading news?

options.label: B
options.text: When an outlet cites credible sources and presents multiple perspectives

options.label: C
options.text: When an outlet uses words like "think," "likely," or "probably" to describe the situation

options.label: D
options.text: When an outlet provides a clear and concise summary of the issue

multiple-choice.question: How should you approach reports that rely on anonymous sources?

options.label: B
options.text: Ignore the report and wait for a report from a different source

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: B
options.text: The decrease in the number of alternative news sources

multiple-choice.question: Why is it crucial to separate fact from opinion when consuming news?

options.label: B
options.text: It is only important to separate fact from opinion in certain types of news stories, such as politics
